She finally did just to immediately be turned around by the GM who said, "can't you see I'm busy".  About 5 minutes later he came and watched the bar. She was gone 3 mins and when she returned you could tell by the body language he was being very rude to her. Once he walked away you could see he felt empowered and above her. This guy needs talked to. He needs to realize we become repeat customers due to the servers and bartenders not because of the GM who never once engaged with a customer. I would easily give 5 stars if not for this GM who obviously is out of his league managing anything.
Good pub food, reasonable prices, and decent service. I had the Irish Lamb Stew, and it was well cooked, tasty, and filling. Not gourmet, but for the price and the ambiance, I'll certainly go back.

When giving reviews I'm always hesitant to give REALLY critical remarks unless I believe my remarks can benefit the business somehow.  I see a lot of potential with this place. Being one of few locations in all of Phoenix that serves an Irish interpretation of food, there is plenty of opportunity for this restaurant to grow with their clientele.  However, before doing so, there are some stark fundamentals of how this business runs its processes that really irk me.  Simply put, there is a lack of consistency all around. You can see this by how diverse the reviews are. 5 star, 1 star, 4 star, 2 star, 5 star, 1 star, etc and so forth.  Some servers here are wonderful, attentive, assertive, and knowledgeable in the business' food menu. Some servers are just a-ok.  The host was either hungover, or simply didn't care about their job, the lack of greeting when my girlfriend and I entered the establishment was too telling, and the lack of charisma let alone eye contact with us as customers further reinforced this.   Now, onto the menu: The menu has some very solid traditional food offerings. Things like Shepard's Pie and Corned Beef and Cabbage are familiar and can be seen as the "prime" of the menu.  As a server though, I was not offered any menu suggestions, or given anything beyond the standard server experience.   This among other reasons is what makes this place just "average". It's a shame, though, given the uniqueness of some aspects in this restaurant, and they sort of just let it go to average. Which, to me, is a waste in this business. You need to have a "wow" factor as a restaurant, and it's so simple, we're not asking you to remodel the tables with new plywood, we're just asking for your servers to be more engaging with the customer.  When our food was delivered, we were not offered any additions, like extra napkins, or a refill on my clearly emptied water. Again, not a bad thing, but not good either. Just average.   To summarize, from a customer POV, mix of good and bad points:   FRONT OF THE HOUSE: * Entered restaurant, the host seemed disinterested and seated us at a table where an elderly person's walker was present * Server who was not our table's greeted my girlfriend and I, but host did not. I don't think I'm allowed to state names on Yelp reviews, so I'll just describe the server who was not ours as having VERY bright red hair. * Server who was not our table's was VERY friendly and gave equal attention to both girlfriend and I. This is a GREAT plus, and why I didn't give a two-star rating. The "front of the house" in a restaurant can make or break a restaurant going experience for your customer. * Server who WAS our table's was friendly * Our server was a bit slow to get our drinks (waited for 5+ minutes after being seated). * Our server was nice with accepting our food order * Our server checked in with us after the food was delivered. * Our server was keen on details and identified the check that my girlfriend hid from the table because my girlfriend doesn't want me to pay for the bill (lol)   THE FOOD: * My parsley garnish on my eggs benedict had grit in them. The parsley was clearly not washed before being minced. OR, the parsley was cut on a dirty board. * The temperature of the potatoes in my eggs benedict dish were not hot. It was as if someone had cooked them, and let them cool for too long. * The cabbage in my girlfriend's corned beef and cabbage dish was not cooked all the way. I am unsure if this is a restaurant preference or if the cook was just lazy and didn't want to wait for the cabbage to cook all the way.  THE BEVERAGES: * We ordered ice water, as we went for lunch and weren't feeling any alcoholic drinks.  * Water came out relatively quickly, had ice, however, I finished mine quickly and was never offered a refill   All in all, it's average right now, but there's hope for the business from a lunchtime perspective. I really hope the business owner takes this review to heart, because I mean well. I didn't want to have to give Rula Bula a 2 star review, but as Yelp states for 2 stars.... "Meh, I've experienced better."  You can be a 3 star restaurant, or even a 4 star with just a little more effort in how you engage your customers and handle your food. Washing parsley takes seconds. A food warmer is  great one-time investment. Coaching your servers and rewarding them for good behavior strengthens your business all around, and more importantly, it makes your customers want to return.

Upon my second trip to Tempe, I had to return to the Rula Bula.  One night, I again had the shepherd's pie, and it was average--not what I raved about 6 months ago.  Maybe an off night for the chef.  Another night, however, I ordered the pork tenderloin dinner and it was fantastic!  It rivaled any dish you might get at an upscale restaurant.  Seriously.    Anyway, people come here to drink and socialize, not for a fine dining experience.  It still gets 4 stars for cool atmosphere, an open-mike night, good Guinness, and a great outdoor patio.
Hate it.  Horrible.  Expensive.  Terrible drinks.  Rude bartenders.

i'm irish. like red hair, freckles, i like lucky charms irish. this place.... isn't irish. sure, it's got Guinness signs and there's Harp on tap, but ahhhhh no. it tries. it really does. i think they had something on the menu called the 'dublin burger'. see? it's trying.  having said that and dispelling this silly rumor that this place is an irish pub, i have to say that its not terribly awful. i dug the whole two bars thing (one in the establishment and one out back on the patio). i love patios. i'm a sucker for outdoor drinking. they have heat lamps out there for when AZ is not 110 degrees. its pretty nice.  service was so so. the bartendress in the front wasn't exactly attentive and kind didn't give a crap if we wanted food or not. the waitress on the patio was great. she was on top of our drink orders and even anticipated others. pretty spiffy.  food was decent. i split the fish and chips and the irish potato nacho-y thingies. for the money, i would say it really wasn't worth it. i would probably head down to gordon biersch to get some bang for your buck in that area but the beer selection was decent and they had harp on tap. points there.   decent place to grab a beer. i also saw that they have a live band come in from time to time. dunno how great that sounds being indoors in that smallish area, but /shrug. to each his own.

I've been here twice now. I got the wings both times. Very good sauce- I did the Rula Bula and, I believe, Guinness BBQ. The beer selection is excellent. We had our first experience with Banana Bread Beer. Amazing!  The Guinness blends are great. Staff was very friendly and attentive. I don't remember the meal i had the first time but I remember being very happy with it.

Happy Hour is ALWAYS fun at Rula Bula its one of my favorite places to go on mill its not filled with college Students but more of a mixture of post grad and established adults.  -The cider on tap is a must if you prefer a light beer  -When they have live music at night the vibe is beyond perfect

St. Paddy's Day! Irish pub in Tempe. Decorated like the auld sod. Nice patio out back. The was starting to crank up when we left, but it wasn't Irish music music. Downtown Tempe was crazy. A spectacle.

I've always loved Rula Bula, but I have to tell you I went there for lunch last weekend during the Tempe Art Festival and they really out did themselves.  The place was packed, but we were warmly greeted and because we didn't mind a high-top table, we were promptly seated.  Our waitress was over the top....very friendly and attentive, as was all the wait staff.  We found out later that our waitress had 19 tables she was covering at that time, but you never would have known it.  The food was excellent, as always, the the drink was even better.

I visited on a Saturday afternoon for brunch and had a great time! The Mac Attack burger was HUGE and the Brussels sprouts as a side were awesome. The service was friendly and attentive and the ambience was fun and rustic. Will definitely come back next time I am in the area.

It's official - I have found my favorite place in Arizona for fish and chips. We came here last night with a large group for drinks before going to see a show at the Marquee Theater but my boyfriend and I snuck off to the bar area inside and ordered a bite to eat. I don't think anyone in the group really noticed we were gone. Plus, it's like 90 degrees outside so A/C sounded really nice to us...  There is a tiny TV in the corner so of course, we sat right in front of it so that my boyfriend could indulge in March Madness or whatever (He loves sports, me - not so much).  Anyway, I ordered a black velvet - it is essentially Guinness with champagne. Brian got a black-and-tan, which is Guinness and harp. I felt like we were preparing for St. Patty's Day (which is today!). I enjoyed my black velvet and would order it again because I personally enjoy Guinness and champagne separately. I also used to work at a Tilted Kilt when I was in college so I would always have a snakebite and a shot after my shifts - loved my Guinness beverages.  The fish and chips were perfect! The cod was battered with the right amount of seasoning and instead of french fries, the dish is served with potato slices. Brian really enjoyed the potato slices but we wished they were a little more crispy. I wish I could give you a better description about the food but that was all we ordered. Because of the sweet tooth I have, I was eyeing up the bread pudding but we decided to leave our seats at the bar and join the rest of our group on the outside patio bar area. So I didn't get it but we will next time! Ugh, if it weren't St. Paddy's Day, we'd go tonight but I'd rather skip the bustle.

It almost feels like someone took a step back and said to themselves, " It's about time we sprinkle a little class on this party street."  In all honesty, I party as much as the next alcoholic cheap beer craving college student, but its still nice for my liver to take a break from the onslaught of cheap Que Club Long Islands and Thursday Barneys Boathouse shenanigans.   With that being said, big ups to Rula Bula for establishing a relaxing, authentic Irish Pub ambience while still serving some hard to find Irish Brews and delicious Irish bar food. Huge fan of the outside-patio set up; it offers enough room for large crowds to get their drink on while still providing a somewhat intimate feel for smaller parties looking for a more laid back night out.   As for the food and drinks; highhhhly suggest going with a frothy pint of Murphy's Stout, followed by a Shepard's Pie that'll leave you feeling as if you're eating in Dublin. Happy Hours are usually pretty solid as well.

This is one of the few places I can go, sit at the bar, & order a nice dinner & maybe a Blue Moon and feel "among my people." Also...I can bring my 80something parents and 50something siblings here on St Pat's Day (granted- DAY, not night) and they fully enjoy it. Finally...this is where I learned that my culture has FOOD! Yes- the Irish have a culinary heritage. Who knew. At Rula it looks like: salmon, boxty, bread pudding ice cream, shepherd's pie. Don't let the bar appetizers keep you from ordering 1 or 2 great entrees....

There's a lot we like about Rula Bula. Hubby adores the Boxty selections, and even gets a little miffed when other Irish places do not serve them. Last time we went, we decided to try items we had not had before, so we opted to share the Fisherman's Platter (with 4 shrimp, 2 pieces of fish, and 1 scallop and chips) and the Irish Mac & Cheese with Rashers (bacon pieces). The Mac was not as stellar as I hoped, but that didn't stop us from finishing the dish. It needed a bit more seasoning, I think. The Platter was good, but the standout for us both was the chips- 1/4 inch slabs of potato cooked to perfection and sprinkled with salt and pepper. The coleslaw was also the way I like it-crispy, and not too sweet. The meal also came with two types of Irish soda bread and a side salad, which made a very nice lunch the next day, as we were completely stuffed from the dishes we shared. Service was attentive, and the prices are fair. We'll be back for the boxty, for sure.

Rula Bula saved my marriage!  Rula Bula also holds the secrets of the Free Masons, is a regular meeting place for the Illuminati, and the Knights Templar once excavated its basement with the goal of finding the Holy Grail.  Okay, now that I have your attention, I can honestly say that only one of those things are true.    The fact of the matter is that I have put off writing a review of Rula Bula for over a year because I have always found it difficult to articulate why I love this place so much.  Anyway, I could put it off no longer, so here it goes:  Many years ago, when I came of drinking age, Rula was one of the first pubs I went to and it has always held a special place in my heart.  Now, do not get me wrong, the reasons that I hold RB in such high regard are not all based upon sentimental nostalgia.  Let us start with the menu.  I am a vegetarian and Rula has always been a safe refuge for me; the vegetarian shepherds pie is phenomenal and their veggie burger is always a safe bet.  Rula also has my favorite dessert in the Valley of the Sun; the Irish Bread Pudding with Vanilla Ice Cream is responsible for an extra five pounds I carry around these days.  Moving on, the ambience of this Irish pub located in the desert is relaxation incarnate.  Okay, let the debate end right here, right now--although Rula Bula's bar and woodwork were constructed in Ireland and shipped to Tempe, this does not make it an authentic Irish pub, and someone arguing either side of that coin is a moron.  Nowhere in the bar, on their menu, or on their website do the owners claim that Rula is an "authentic" Irish pub.  RB is 7500 miles from Ireland, so no, it is not going to be exactly like the homeland.  Also, I do not seem to read a lot of reviews of people complaining that Pizzeria Bianco's food and ambience is not authentic, the way it is in Naples; get over it, people.  Beer!  I love that I can get all of my favorite Irish and English beers on tap here.  Live music!  I love their open mic night and basically all the other nights during the week when they have great bands playing.  One last point, they have a great staff of bartenders and servers.  Enjoy!

Not sure who would give them anything less than 5 stars. Every time I go Rula Bula, I leave more amazed with Irish cuisine. Everything on the menu I have tried was perfect and if I could, I would eat here every night.  Thanks for introducing me Irish brown bread!

Since everyday is a good day for a Guinness, and since I happen to be on Mill every single day, this is the spot I like to come to collaborate those 2 facts of life. I also really love that I get free drinks, often, but I think its just the red hair. Seriously, red heads in Irish pubs.. I could tell stories for days..  Its not exactly your model Irish pub, but they have a decent happy hour, yummy menu options, lots of space and a sweet patio with an outdoor bar. The only real downfall here is the douchey dudes that are always here and that it is always retardedly packed after 8pm. Otherwise, its all good. Seriously subtract that and add a mechanical Bull or something equally obnoxious, and I'm a fan for life.

actually really like this place, but rarely come here. probably cause it's on the Mill "strip" and just about everything else there is not like this place at all.  this is a fairly large pub complete with brass accented bar and hardwood floors. the food is super English/Irish with Shepard's Pie and other "meat and potatoes" fare. not cheap, but it's unique and good, so it's worth it.  there is live music every weekend, and possibly during the week, too. i think weekends after 10 they start charging a cover, but it's only like $3. it can get really loud inside, especially with the live music, but thankfully, there's a huge outdoor courtyard area with a bar, which is where i spend my time there.  the crowd can be college, but not obnoxious college, it's a laid back crowd of students and older folk, too. the place can get pretty busy during the semester, and sometimes the wait at the bar is frustrating.  all in all, it's a cool place, especially among all the other trashy, club-like places that abound in that area. i only knock off a star for the terrible indoor acoustics and bar service during peak hours, which can't really be helped anyway.

First off, let me say that Rula Bula is one of my favorite pubs to just chill and get a great cocktail. They also introduced me to one of my favorite snack-and-drink combos: the Irish chips with curry dipping sauce and a glass of Irish Mule (or maybe two ;) )   So why am I giving them a barely 3-star review right now? It's sad to say but last night, I realized as good as their curry sauce and Irish Mule are; they are probably the only two things I'll ever order from Rula Bula.   The Irish dip I ordered last night was mediocre. Since I know the Irish chips are thicker than regular chips, I specifically asked for mine to be extra crispy and they came out even soggier than normal :(   Service: I has received good service here from most of my visits before. However, my server last night was not very attentive. She took a really long time to notice that we were ready to order our food. Once received our orders, she took another while to come by and check on us. So I never even bother to ask for a side of ranch that I originally wanted.   Overall, this review is specifically for my experience from last night. I am sure Rula Bula can and will do better than this.
One of the few places in town with Ace Pear Cider on tap...good job. the outdoor patio is nice and the old Irish feel of the indoor bar is always a plus. Some of the best fish and chips in the area.

I've always loved Rula Bula. It's a great, laid-back atmosphere. They've got a great variety of Irish whiskeys, as well as some perfect Irish boxty, a potato pancake. It's quirt hard to find any boxty in AZ, much less something so good as this. The braised (in Guinness) beef boxty is savory, tender and wrapped in that fluffy pancake. NOT a breakfast food, at all.
Rula Bula has great food, good atmosphere and is located in a fun area. The outside patio area is also a fun place to kick back.

This restaurant is a fun place to grab a Guinness and a Shepherds Pie!! (which, by the way, is awesome!) They have a good menu with enough choices to satisfy most appetites. They offer a great patio space providing room for small groups up to large groups parties.  They host a fantastically fun St. Patrick's Day party including singers and traditional Irish dance troops.  Iv'e experienced this event several times with no fail of a great time!!! The staff has always been accommodating and friendly. Parking is provided in the lot on the north side of the restaurant along with a free parking code for up to 2 hours.  The atmosphere inside is warm, cozy, and clean.  I like all the wood and stained glass decor and the bar is a great one to 'belly' up to. If you're looking for a comfortable place that serves great Irish food, give it a try.  The chef is typically open for special requests as I have made a few without any attitude or hassle. Give this place a try.  And yes, there is a Happy Hour....perfect if you have a fun group of friends in need of a Friday night fix! :)

Rula Bula is a cool irish pub located on Mill Ave. They did have an outside area, but it  was very busy so we where sitted inside. The food was really good. I loved the appetizer sampler that I ordered.   There was a live band on night we where in there. Very hard to talk to anyone. So FYI not a good date place after certain hours as you can hear each other.

When Rula Bula opened I was pretty excited because I like things like Guiness and shepard's pie.  Both of these things are decent at Rula Bula and given the other choices along Mill Ave, this place looks like a foodie's wet dream.  The thing I like the most about Rula Bula is the wooden fixtures and the decor.  Oh, how I do not miss hanging out in Tempe, but if I had to go back, I'd stop by Rula Bula..
Lots of fun - great deck in the AZ Spring temps, and a great location on Mill Ave.  The service is a bit slow if you want a server, but if you get your own drinks then not bad.  Also, a bit pricy.

I ordered the French Onion soup and the fish-n-chips. Both were very good. Atmosphere was good, except I was there on a Friday, and halfway through my meal a rock/party band started playing. Decent band, but killed the atmosphere to be having fish and chips and Guinness while a band is whaling away on an Eagles tune. Instantly transformed from an Irish pub to every other party bar on the street. Even before the band they had alternative music playing on the sound system. 5 stars for food, but minus 2 for atmosphere and lack of a theme commitment.

This was my first time trying Rula Bula. My boyfriend had been previously and spoke very highly of it. So during an evening stroll on Mill Avenue, we decided it would make a great spot for dinner.  I had the shepherds pie and he had the bangers and mash... Both were exceptional. The menu noted that the shepherds pie had been voted "best of Phoenix", and I quickly realize why. The dish was savory and flavorful, comfort food at its finest!  Despite becoming full only a third of the way through my meal, I pressed on! I told myself that each bite would be my last until there was nothing left on my plate.  I'm not sure what wizardry was used to create this meal, but I feel it might be black magic & I'm totally okay with that.  If I could give them 6 stars, I would.
I like this place if I want to go out and grab drink. The nightlife atmosphere there is chill and not crazy like the other bars. They serve good cider.
Gone downhill. The corn beef from Safeway is much better. Super thin sliced here, robbery, potatoes and carrots half cooked. Try four peaks to see the difference

Best Margarita's at an Irish Pub??  Yes Yes and YES!  They were super refreshing that the first one quickly tasted like another.  There were 4 in our party and 3 of us ordered salads, one friend opted for the brunch menu and got the omelet of which she said was delish!.  I had the Irish Cobb Salad with their house made garlic herb vinaigrette.  Best Cobb salad I have ever had!  So fresh and the chicken was cooked perfectly.  There is a tendency to overcook it on a salad.  Service was on par and very friendly!  Will definitely be back on my next visit to the area!  Oh, and there was live music too.  Put that together with the beautiful afternoon and all was picture perfect. Good job!!

Rula Bula was really really fun.   The outside patio was SUPER packed...I was pushing people out of the way just to walk inside. The inside was empty...must have just been that kind of night. The band playing inside was really great, they played some old Journey and such. We left as soon as people started fighting on the patio...  Go here for a rowdy time!

I am going to give this place only 3 stars because 1, I have a 95% chance of getting kicked out whenever I go here, lol.  It always seems to be the case and 2, the food is ok, nothing spectacular.  With that being said it actually is a really cool bar.  It has a psuedo authenticity to it that makes you feel like you're in Ireland they have great live Irish music.  That is always a positive.  I find the beer selection to be pretty good and the vibe to be pretty good as well.  Although not the best Irish bar I have ever been to (I am from Boston) it's definitely the best Irish bar I have been to in Arizona, and one of my top 2 spots on Mill Ave.
Great service + great food + great beer = five stars. The bartender Camille knows her beers.  Fish and chips are excellent (as they advertised).

I came here because it is a location in a book series that I love and I got super excited once I found it was a real place.  As someone who has spent a lot of time in Ireland, I'm pretty picky when it comes to Irish food. And I have very little patience for Americanized Irish food.  First impressions: * Downtown Tempe is super cool * The decor is legit inside of Rula Bula * The staff are super nice, especially the bartender who helped us (tall white male, tattoos, plugs - didn't catch his name) * They have Magners on draft! Which I've never seen in the US  Unfortunately the food wasn't that great. I got the steak and guinness pie and it was a bit bland. The portion was generous and all meat but it needed more Guinness and more salt. The sides were very good.  My Mom got Fish and Chips and she wasn't that impressed either. The pieces were small and also bland.  BUT on a happy note, my friend got the Mussels and really enjoyed them.  I would absolutely go back, they have cool stuff happening every night. And the bartender was super cool. But I don't know that I would eat here again. Probably just drink. The food prices just aren't justified.  (That said, I do want to go back for breakfast and see how their Full Irish Breakfast is)
We had cobb salad and corned beef and cabbage. Everything was great. Our server got our granddaughters balloon off the ceiling twice. Great atmosphere. We'll be back.

A little over 5 years ago Mr. M came to me and said, "Do you hate winter?  I hate winter".  I said, "I've always hated winter".  And then we started plans to move to Arizona.  I had been here many times over the years, but he had never been to the desert.  So you know me with my wily ways, I planned a fantastic scouting trip in the middle of March and we left St. Louis crappy winter/early spring weather to spend 4 days here in the Phoenix metro area.  One of the things we did was visit Rula Bula around St. Paddy's day and had great food, even better drinks, and got to see the Keltic Cowboys play. That was one of the rare nights in the past 10 years where I stayed up until 2 a.m.!!  What a great time.  Ever since then we've been back maybe 2 dozen times over the years and always have a great time.  For us we really enjoy getting some exercise around Tempe Town Lake and then rolling in here around 2 in the afternoon.  It's usually quiet and we can gab with the bartender and have a relaxing time.    On our most recent visit, about 2 weeks before Christmas, we stopped in on a Sunday completely unaware that they have a weekend brunch menu.  I had the traditional benedict plus avocado and really enjoyed that one.  I loved the fact that they put it on puff pastry instead of a heavier bread item.  I usually have to take half home, but this time I ate it all by myself and only let Mr. M have one teeny bite.    The Black Velvet cocktail on the menu sounded interesting and it was.  Champagne with some Guinness floating on top.  Pretty to look at and even better to drink.  We now have some Guinness and cheap champagne in the fridge to make one of those whenever we want.  Mr. M had his usual Guinness BBQ wings and some Jameson on the rocks.  No complaints there.  Jody took great care of us at the bar.  All in with the food and drinks it was $32.90 before tax and tip.  We always look forward to a visit to Rula Bula.

I have been here at least half a dozen time (only four "check-ins").  Never had a bad meal or bad service.  For the delicious photo associated with this post is Bangers & Mash.  The meal came with glazed carrots. The mashed potatoes were very good. The carrots were good, too. The sausages were fair. They tasted a lot like some breakfast sausage I have had. They were nothing to write home about. Honestly, they were a bit disappointing. The one outstanding thing was the gravy. I've had sex that was less enjoyable.  It was great!  If they sold it on its own, I'd buy a gallon and a straw.  (Update on 06/13/16: Ordered the Bangers & Mash again only to be disappointed.  The once "nectar of the gods" has been reduced to a thin excuse for gravy where the beef component is beneath an amorphous layer of grease.  This was once a great dish.  Add to this experience poor service from my waitress - she nearly didn't exist; I saw here ten minutes after I sat down and again 40min later for my bill.  There was also an obnoxious aroma of fish in the restaurant.  Not the smell of cooking fish but the smell of a boat deck.  I have lowered the rating to three stars.)  I have also had the Fish & Chips, and my son has had the burger.  All were good.  The outdoor seat is nice when it isn't "hell-fire" hot in Phoenix.

I really like lunch at this place and think they have some great values on their menu.  I often get the lamb stew and along with the soda bread it ends up being more than I can eat.  I've always eaten up at the bar and the same bartender has been there to serve me over several years and he always goes above and beyond service expectations (I really appreciate that he always wants to know if I like my food after the first bite and always asks if I want a go cup for my drink as I'm paying).  Definitely a great place for lunch and at night they often have live music which rotates between inside and the patio based on the weather.  This is certainly one of my favorite spots in Tempe.

Irish Pubs.  I probably don't give them a second thought for about 363 days out of the year.  Granted that's likely in part because I don't have any trace of Irish ancestry that I can discern, but that's also partly because (1) I'm not a heavy drinker and (2) traditional Irish food has always been kinda meh to me.  That said, you can certainly count me as one of the multitudes of people who've passed through Rula Bula's doors at least once.  Before tonight's lovely International Supper Club UYE event (special thanks to Monica O for organizing it), my last stop at Rula Bula was at about 5 years ago on a sweltering August Saturday night amongst hoards of ASU students (long story).  This time, a weeknight dinner under the stars with ASU students thankfully on Spring Break.  It's been a while since I've tried Rula Bula's menu, so tonight it was time to rediscover one of the valley's longest standing Irish establishments.  Set in one of Tempe's oldest buildings (the more than century old Andre Building on Mill Avenue), Rula Bula has been a fixture for locals, tourists, and ASU students for decades.  The name Rula Bula translates to "uproar and commotion" in Irish Gaelic and the name fits the product quite accurately.  The interior has the feel of a quintessential old world pub with a relatively limited amount of seating and a small corner used for live music alongside the obligatory bar.  The patio out back has a bar of its own with some extra seating (though they often remove some of the tables and chairs from the patio to pack in more patrons during super busy nights).  You could be perfectly comfortable here during happy hour or during dinner hours most nights.  On weekend nights, however, the place will get raucous with big crowds and live music to boot.  I've had the corned beef and cabbage as well as the bangers and mash here before.  Tonight it was time to go outside the box.  Or perhaps I should say inside the box.  Okay forget that word salad, I ordered the Boxty.  Never heard of it?  Neither had I until I read the menu.  Basically a potato crepe stuffed with braised beef cooked down in...well Guinness of course.  Also got a side of Rula Bula fries (basically shoestring fries with a little extra spice).  To wash it all down, I went with a Guinness Blonde (not a fan of the old school Guinness so this was the compromise).  Total cost for the food, drink, tax and tip came to about $27.  For the record the Guinness Blonde was fine.  Harp remains my favorite Irish brew, but Guinness Blonde is a perfectly passable and relatively light lager.  The boxty was a fairly decent portion and the braised beef was excellent.  The beer flavor was evident, but complimented the meat juices rather than overpowered it.  The crepe itself was something of an afterthought which was surprising since supposedly the traditional boxty is really all about the potatoes.  The fries were a pretty good pairing and soaked up the meat juices pretty well, though I'd probably go with the whipped potatoes as a pairing the next go around.  As with other trips I've had to Rula Bula I would pretty much rate the overall experience as okay.  Not great, not terrible, just okay.  The food was okay, the service was on the slow (but friendly) side, and the prices might be just a tad steep both for the food and beverage.  I suppose your outlook on Rula Bula and Irish Pubs in general probably just depend on your expectations.  If you're here to ham it up with your friends or the other patrons with a beer in hand, then you'll probably feel right at home.  If you're looking for a solid sit down restaurant experience, you might be disappointed on some fronts.  If you're looking for a St. Patrick's Day option, I will say from experience that Rula Bula is a fun place to be on St Patty's Day with great music and great vibes.  I may not frequent Irish Pubs often, but I can confidently say that Rula Bula is up there with the best you'll find in the valley.
Pre-game dinner before the ASU vs Stanford baseball game at the Muni. They serve Fish & Chips the way it was meant to be. Guiness is smooth, cold & creamy. TREMENDOUS !!

Rula Bula means something along the lines of a 'fun party,' and this Irish pub didn't disappoint!  A friend and I came here after she'd heard great things about it, and I'm glad we did - Rula Bula is definitely different from the typical Mill Ave bar scene, with a slightly older crowd.  They have a good selection of beers and ciders on tap, including Magners (they have bottled pear, and apple on tap), which I hadn't had since studying abroad years ago!  They have lots of seating, both indoor and outdoor, which makes for an easy time finding a table.. just be aware that the patio is smoking-friendly though, so if you're sensitive to second-hand smoke, it might be better to sit inside.  Our server was also very friendly, and checked in with us regularly to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.    I only ordered cider while there, but my friend also got their shepherd's pie, due to the positive reviews.  Before we'd met up, she'd mentioned craving mashed potatoes, which was a good thing I guess, because the dish appeared to be about 75% potato, 25% everything else.. it was also only lukewarm when she got it, but our server was kind enough to heat it a bit more.    Overall, in terms of atmosphere and service I'd give Rula Bula a 5/5, but I took off 1 star because of my friend's dinner. If you're looking for an Irish pub, and want a different experience from the typical Mill scene, I'd recommend trying out Rula Bula :)

Of course this place makes its name as a pub, but I'll review it as a restaurant.  I stopped in here for lunch last week, as Irish food sounded like a nice change of pace from the usual.  The lunch menu had several appealing options.    I had the Shepherd's Pie (with Cheese).  I will say, it tasted great.  I've always been a fan of Shepherd's Pie, and this didn't disappoint.  My colleague had the fish and chips, which looked tasty as well.  The only complaint I had was that the portions are a bit small.  I know it probably wouldn't be healthy, but I probably could've eaten two of those pies.
Visiting Tempe and was just walking off dinner and decided to stop in for a beer.  Wound up smoking a good cigar and having a few pints.  Very friendly staff

Came in on St.Patrick's Day after the Flogging Molly concert and smooth jazz music is on??!! Big. Fat. Fail. We had to ask them to put it on something different (How about some irish drinking music, it's St Patty's Day for pete's sake!) and it took the manager/bartender forever to get around to it. It looks like it was just somebody's ipad plugged into the system playing Pandora. On a side note, our female bartender was flipping awesome and knew a LOT of scotches.

Had a great time with my wife and daughter.  Friendly pub environment, great staff, good food and a decent beer selection.  Lots of cool nick backs to look at, old saddles, swords on the wall, Pat Tillman memorabilia, etc.  ate at the bar and that was fun.  The overall experience is a 5.

Service is pretty good and food is incredible!  I would bump this up to five stars if service was a little faster.  That being said, the food and booze alone are worth the hype.  Their entire traditional menu is on point.  Shepard's pie is MASSIVE and the meat is juicy and perfectly flavored. Happy hour is a must do because their prices are unheard of for anything I've experienced on mill ave.  The Black and Tans are almost perfectly poured.  They cater to the ASU crowd which makes the energy/atmosphere lively and exciting. If you want delicious Irish pub food I wouldn't suggest anything else!

By far the best Irish Pub in the area!  The food is delicious, standard Irish fare.  Great whiskey selection, and the expected Irish beer selection as well.  PLUS- Every Friday night, The Paper Snowmen play, and they rock.

I just moved here and wanted to go check out the local Irish pub. Well Rula Bula did just that! A classic Irish pub with all the right beers and a fantastic choice of whiskys. Good food, nice bartenders and Irish music to go along with it. Try it out. Slainta!

I'm not a big fan of the 'new' Mill Ave but life is about change... I had never been to Rula Bula before but checked it out with a friend. I honestly can't remember what my friend ordered and I apologize for that. I had the award winning fish & chips. I totally get the award thing, this dish was absolutely perfect! I have no idea how to fry fish and potato slices and have them come out not at all greasy- not a bit! Maybe they bake 'em, don't know... The batter on the fish was light, correct amount and light golden brown. The fish was flaky, perfectly cooked and outstanding! The chips were potato slices also delectable. There were no random potato ends, just perfect slices. I opted out of vinegar, instead I got a side of house tartar sauce. It too was excellent. There was a trivia contest going on but it wasn't distracting. While the front matches the rest of Mill Ave brick-a-brac the inside had the look of early/middle 19th Century. The patio looked gorgeous and the staff were attentive, polite and friendly. I'm headed back soon

My friends and I went on a Saturday afternoon. The restaurant was warm inside which made it quiet uncomfortable. The drinks we ordered were the Pear cider, banana fosters mixed drink and Guinness. The drink were all great. The food however was not that enjoyable. We had the Rula Bula wings and a potato ball thing. They were both less than desirable so we did not order anything else. Great place for drinks!

I am part of an organization called Stupid Cancer that helps raise awareness for young adults with cancer and everything they have to go through. Well I decided to have a meetup for other young adults and their caregivers at Rula Bula! I had been there plenty of times before as I live nearby however, on the night I had my meetup, all the staff were exquisitely helpful. We were served in a timely manner, our food was delicious, we were given ample space for everyone that attended, and the best part is when we were given a challenge to take a picture with 15 strangers to help raise awareness, the staff was only too willing to help! Love Rula Bula and I will stay a very loyal customer for a long time to come!

Love this place. Been here several times and it never disappoints. First time i came here my bf and i just moved to tempe from sun city west. We really like Irish pubs and this one is the only one that i know that serves Magners cider.  The food is also good too. I ordered shrimp wrapped in bacon as an appetizer and it was amazing. The shrimp were large and the bacon was thick.  The servers and bartenders are friendly too. I've never had an unfriendly bartender or a server. One my favorite places to eat on mill.
Came out for lunch and looks as though the fried fish were their signature dishes or the typical bar food.  They have Guinness on tap, enough said!  They have a huge patio at the back and full bar.

Very close to the Irish experience. Some of the staff and musicians have that Irish flare. Food was authentic and very good. The menu offers most of well known Irish culinary fare. Prices very affordable. Had the Bangers and Mash, tasty and more than enough to fill. This is the place for Bloody Mary's.  One the best I've had. Worth the stop when in the Tempe area.

We went here for dinner and drinks last night with some friends and had a great time!  The food was surprisingly good, great service, great atmosphere...and the band was AMAZING!  I could listen to them every weekend, they were so good!  The shepard's pie, boxty and chicken sandwich were all delicious!

Oh my Rula, did you redeem yourself?  It seems they might have - but I think another visit will tell for sure.  Someone sure dialed down the douchebaggery this time around, or it was an off night.  As our first official stop on our pub crawl, we met several friends there - all in all, ended up with about 20 people.  The staff was friendly, the bar tenders nice, fun and actually helpful, and the music, while not live, was at the perfect level.  Most of my group got food, and watching the locust like destruction, I'd have to guess it was all pretty good.  Their drink prices are still a little high, but at least the pours seemed to match this time around.    I'll be willing to keep going back if the service and atmosphere keeps improving like this.

Really nice patio. It's surrounded by vines and has plenty of misters to keep you cool even when it's 115 out. Awesome food, better drinks, and one of the waiters made a special shot for me with Jack Daniels and Goldschlagger that tastes like Christmas.
I've been here a few times for work and pleasure and I've had a great experience every time.  Friendly servers and good food. Leave room for dessert.

Rula Bula is a "must visit" for the Mill Avenue visitor. It is a great place to just sit with friends, have a drink and talk. That is after all what an Irish pub is supposed to be. There is an excellent back patio with a satellite bar and misters. The food is typical Irish fare with everything from boxty to shepherds pie. Try the Hot Bollocks Spicy Potato Balls and wash it down with one of the hard ciders they have on tap.

Pricey. Cornbeef sandwiches are $10 and up. Yes, it was Irish cut cornbeef (thicker slices). The sweet potatoes were done right. The sandwich was tasty, though lacking of Swiss cheese. It would have been nicer if under $10. Washed it down with a half and half. The beer was a fair price. So bring your Celtic coin. Thanks for reading. The Bike Chaplain

Considering that all of us were roaring drunk on New Years and this pub was part of the rowdy block party in downtown Tempe, our experience was pretty smooth here. Our waiter was very friendly, made sure our drinks were refilled and that we had plenty of water, and even furnished us with silly party hats, streamers, and noisemakers. The fish and chips were tasty, made more so by the awesome tartar sauce, and the corned beef, though a little dry, was tasty too. The whole pib was assembled in Ireland, and is pretty charming and not at all pub-sized, with plentyof seating for all.

The first time we went it was FANTASTIC! I mean right down to the shamrock topping off my Guinness.   The second time was good but no shamrock kinda bummed about it.   The third time was a let down, no consistency and I doubt I will go back totally bummed. A real Meh experience.  I hope it gets better but tillI hear the shamrocks back I'm staying at Fibber's.

This is your average, run of the mill (no pun intended) Irish Pub. And it doesn't try to pretend to be anything else, nor does it need to.  The outdoor patio is especially nice, both on nice days, and even in the winter (they have epic heaters outside).   The happy hour is great, both for food and booze.  They don't have a ton of vegetarian options, so I've been using this place as more of a bar than a place for food.  However, their bread pudding is surprisingly delicious, and worth ordering. Also, in the winter, they have alcoholic hot chocolate, which is AMAZING. Really, really amazing.  Staff is nice and helpful, really fun. Wednesday night is trivia night, so they'll be packed. Be forewarned.  This is a great place to meet friends for a pint (they have cider too!) and have a good time.  Not a great place for vegetarians to eat.

Nice atmosphere.  A fun atmosphere during St. Patrick's day.  Service is average at best.  The food is about average.  I previously tried the corn beef, which was bland.  I tried The fish n' chips were pretty good,  perhaps one of the best fish n' chips in the Phoenix valley.
Fun atmosphere, mixed crowd (some young and some older), decent food - live music and trivia nights. Been going for years, but it seems to be going down hill a little, or maybe I am just getting old!

It was just ok, I had the Rula Bula burger which was really messy. It was hard to eat. The taste was okay, nothing special but it's a nice atmosphere. Nice for a night out. I've eaten at other Irish Pubs in Chicago and as far as food it just didn't meet my expectations but the place and service was nice.

Rula Bula is among my favorite bars in town, and is easily my favorite place on Mill.  They have a great atmosphere with awesome live music, and while it can get crowded on busy nights, it's never so packed that you can't move around.  The patio is great year-round (they have heaters for when it gets "cold"), and they have a full bar inside and out.  The inside is gorgeous and feels classy without being pretentious.  As far as prices go, they're not the cheapest, but it's reasonable.  The best part is they have a great whisky/whiskey selection - amongst the best in Tempe (if not the best)!  I can't recommend Rula enough!

was here mostly for drinks..but did end up ordering a few appetizers.  Hot bollix spicy potato balls were very thick and heavy lol but oh soooo good.  basically a deep fried mash potato ball with a kick.    Hot Bollix Spicy Potato Balls An original creation of deep fried potato, rashers (Irish  bacon), scallions and Irish cheddar cheese balls  and  Grilled Bacon Wrapped Shrimp Six shrimp and applewood smoked bacon skewers served  with Guinness BBQ dipping sauce  these shrimps were medium sized... cooked just right.

Pretty good place if you are looking for an Irish Pub. There are much better out there, but for Tempe it's pretty good. Prices are EXPENSIVE, and sometimes they have trouble pouring... but it is a great atmosphere and usually a chill crowd.

I have very mixed feelings about this place. The food is very good, great fish and chips, wings, and the "comfort food" is amazing! However, this place has consistently terrible service. I eat here often for the food and I can honestly say I have never once had a good service experience.   On my most recent visit we waited 5 minutes for the host to even appear at the front desk. After we were seated someone brought us waters and it was 15 minutes until we tracked down a waiter to help us.   I observed the manager walking aimlessly around the restaurant ignoring the fact he had 1 waiter working every table inside and that his host kept walking to the back patio to fraternize which at one point caused a couple to give up waiting at the front desk and leave.   This experience isn't representative of every time I've been here but it is never much better.   Bottom line: the food is consistently pretty good but the service/management needs to be overhauled. Also, lay off the blasting of Irish folk music, I understand it's an Irish restaurant but it can be quite overbearing.

Used to be a saddle shop in 1886.  Now an Irish pub.  Enjoyed my Fish and Chips with a pint of Guinness.  As authentic an Irish pub you will find in Phoenix, Arizona. Very friendly and efficient staff.  Love the design - I don't feel like I am in a gimmicky chain restaurant.

Let me start by saying my requirement for any place that calls itself an Irish pub is that they carry Strongbow or Harp. Most places I go have one or the other (mostley just a lot of Harp). They not only had both, but the Strongbow was on tap.*drool*  I went out to dinner here first. Then hit it up later as a bar. The food is fantastic! The old world and new world menus are a great way to make sure that everyone in your party can be happy.

I would probably frequent this place is I lived in Phoenix...well more likely if I was a student in Tempe.   The inside and the outside are very large so it didn't give me that 'I feel so crowded that I can't breathe, touch me and die' feeling.  Usually I don't like Irish pubs because they tend to feel like caves but this one was quite the opposite.   The bartenders were all friendly and prompt.  Everyone there seemed to be having a good time.  There was even a live band which was Irish music.  When the band wasn't playing the music they had going was all pretty decent rock stuff.   My only complaint was the immense amount of cigarette smoke.  I guess it's my own fault for sitting outside...but it seemed like everyone there was smoking all at the same time and blowing it all in my direction.  Oh and also, the bathroom was pretty small for such a big place.   Anyways...  cool place.

My wife and I love Rula Bula!  We enjoy the atmosphere and the food.  If you find yourself in Tempe and want to go to an Irish Pub, make your way to Rula Bula.  By the way, the corned beef sandwich is amazing!!
Food was fresh and tasty. Great Irish fare. The vegetarian shepards pie with mashed potatoes was satisfying and different.  The service was a bit slow, but friendly. Very relaxed atmosphere.

Best pub in the valley! Great atmosphere, the whole place is decorated in a way that makes you feel like you've been transported to Ireland. The waitstaff is always welcoming and kind, and the food is always so good and hardy! My personal favorites are the Shepards pie and the Boxty. I also highly recommend the apple crumble! This is a absolute must if you love Irish food or pubs. Beware though, after 10 pm they start carding so leave those under 21 at home.

we decided to give this place a whirl for a few brews and food before heading to the celeberty theater for a show. we found street parking across the street.......score. we went in and took a seat just inside the door. we sat there for a few minutes before our very pleasent wait person came over she took our drink order and came back within a few minutes again. we went ahead and ordered the guiness barbque sauce wings ,fish nuggetts w/chips and for a potato overkill the skins as well all the food was very tasty . she informed us that a wait person had called in ill and that was why the service was a little slow.....not that i ask because i thought the service was just fine for as busy as it was...................we will add a 1/2 star just for that

I've been to Rula Bula a few times, most recently for Happy Hour. They have some decent HH specials--discounted appetizers and drinks. The food has always been good at Rula Bula, and the service friendly. As far as atmosphere, you can't ask for anything better than an authentically imported Irish bar. Well, you could ask for an authentically imported Irish beer too...but they have you covered in that aspect as well.

Always good cheer, scrumptious food, and a great time. We went as a couple with friends after a show at ASU-Gammage, sitting in their beer garden. Nice brew selection plus warm winter drinks like mint hot cocoa with whipped cream. Tasty wings and outstanding hot bollix (don't ask, just order). Burgers were well above board, and Rula Bula serves some of the best steamed mussels in the Valley. Vegetarian shepherds pie was good scran. And the wait staff were funny and friendly. Theater tickets get discounts on entrees. We used to go for quiz night Wednesdays but recently it's been a destination for a consistently enjoyable special night out.

Before I begin, I would like to point something out to the Yelpers of Tempe, Az-  All of the Guinness in the United States is imported from Ireland.  Yes, there are other breweries outside of Ireland, but America only receives Guinness from Ireland.  So, it stands to reason, that Rula Bula would, indeed, have imported-from-Ireland Guinness. That is nothing special.   However, the two times I've been to Rula Bula, the Guinness was poured well (one server even attempted the shamrock in the head... she didn't quite succeed, but she was new and it was the effort that counts).  Also, the food it super yummy!  I can't wait to drive back to Arizona in a few weeks, just so I can have the whiskey bread pudding again! It is the stuff of dreams and nightmares... nightmares only because I'm always too full to eat it all- but it's always too delicious to stop eating it!

I'm on a business trip in Tempe for 5 weeks, found this place on Yelp and gave it a shot. I'm glad I did, I've been about half a dozen times now (still have a few weeks of my trip left). I haven't had anything I didn't like, and I order something different each trip. The fish and chips are some of the best I've had in a long time. Although I eat alone and do not order alcohol (read smaller tab) I've received great service every time I've been here. I would highly recommend this place.
Greatest Draft Beer selection on the Mill Avenue.   Guinness Smithwick's Harp Bass Magners Four Peaks** seasonal and recurring Lagunitas And many more

I admit a 1 star is a bit harsh, but I am rating the Shepherds PIe.  If you have McBar shipped over from Ireland and serve Guinness, congrats to you and the hundreds if not thousands across the country to do the same.   Doesn't make you authentic.    Now for the Shepherds Pie.  Gross.  Totally inedible, so I didn't eat it.   Btw, Sheep need a Shepherd.  Cows need a cowboy.  Shepherds pie is made with LAMB!  Either way this was gross.  The waitress was very nice and took it off the bill and I had some bacon-wrapped shrimp so I wasn't starving.  The Guinness was fine.

I am very picky about fish and chips, so I will say that they are OK here. The main reason to go to Rula Bula would be for the atmosphere. The back patio is great for people watching and just relaxing with friends. It does get frustrating when you just want a drink outside, but a local band happens to be playing inside so you have to pay a cover to get in. I know that's the situation with a lot of other bars, but it doesn't help that I can go to a very similar bar a quarter of a mile down and not pay a cover.

Hey Yelpers,  Was outvoted on coming here with my work friends for lunch. I admit not a huge fan of simple Irish food but made the best of it. Got the lunch special chicken salad wrap with potato salad.   They say everything is made from scratch and so far I can say I disagree. The wrap was good. At least the amount I got. What I mean by that is I pretty much got a whole sliced tomato in my wrap and a side of the chicken walnut mix. Pic attached. I was pretty bummed out on that. I think it's reasonable to expect a normal amount of tomato on a wrap. Seriously, these were like 1 inch thick slices in there. So when I first picked up the wrap I was really excited thinking I scored major Protein but to only be denied the wonderful goodness of chicken for a half rip tomato. Darn.   The potato salad was 4 stars and the service was decent. All in all, I left hungry and went back to the office to drown my so sorrows in animal crackers.

I've come to Rula Bula A LOT in my 10 years of living in arizona. I remember taking my parents here as an ASU undergrad, taking dates here as a twenty something single person, and apparently still coming back today. I've always loved the food and drinks.   But for some reason, the place has never really struck a cord enough to review but I now want to only because I absolutely loved the band that was here. The audio was perfect and they actually made the night a lot better, which is unusual for a cover band. I'm not just saying this because I got a free CD. Rula Bula consistently delivers

Every time we come here the food is extremely delicious. The service here is also good. We always order the Irish potato skins for an appetizer. It comes with 5 pieces and we are a family of 3. I wish it was 6 pieces but not a big deal. They are tasty. For dinner I get the bistro filet medallions and it is absolutely amazing. The place is loud but it is a bar and we always come during dinner time. We've always been satisfied with the food and service here.

well, you can't give 5 stars to Irish cooking but a good solid 4 will do. my friend and I eat here often and have probably tried most of the lunch offerings. always good and always warm and served with a smile. good music, good beer, and good craic. try it St. Patrick's Day, we did and had a wonderful time. by the way, the bread pudding is to die for.

Been here a few times. Its good for HH but the food is off a bit. Whatever, it's good atmosphere and food and drinks are decent. I would go again but I have to say when I think of HH and or drinks and food this place never comes to mind. That should tell you something I guess?

I stopped by here last night for a friends going away party. (sniff sniff) Cute little place. The drinks were good (Southern Peach gets a thumbs up from me) and like everyone said, the fish and chips are YUMMO!!! I had the sweet potatoes fries with my fish and everything was scrumptious. They even had spicy ketchup, which is a rare find. Either I was hungry or it was really good because I could have licked my plate if I was allowed.  We also ordered a side of the the mac and cheese, which was just ok, only because we didn't know that it had ham in it and it made the mac and cheese taste very salty so I only had a bite or two. ( We didn't see it on the menu but we saw that someone else had ordered it hence the reason we ordered it.) I think without the ham, it would  have been pretty ok.  So with that said, great food, fabulous company, a little eye candy here and there, what more could a girl ask for?

Despite the strangely low reviews we came here because one of our favorite authors writes a story where the main characters visit Rula Bula often. We were in the area and thought it would be fun to check it out. The service was great from the moment we stepped in until the moment we left. And what an awesome atmosphere. It looked like I would imagine an old Irish pub looking.   We weren't hungry but we had heard they had great bread pudding (one of my favorite desserts) so we tried that. It was awesome!!  Hope to come back here sometime to try the fish and chips!!

I went here last Thursday with some alumni from my alma mater.  I have to say that the food was alright, not exceptional.  We had some fish and chips, potato skins and some other food that does not come to mind.  The atmosphere is a typical bar.  It feels like any bar, any where.  Basic beer, mixed drinks, etc.  It is strange, but this place did not have a unique feel to it.  I could have been anywhere.........

This is my favorite bar. There is atmosphere, good food, good music, and good drinks. What else can you ask for?  The outside patio can be a great setting for a romantic lunch while the inside is home to many a happy and loud night. Cider and reggae, salad and traditional Irish grub... I still have not tried the boxty. This place has some vegetarian options, mainly salads, but those are delicious.  This is the perfect place to cure those didn't-do-well-on-my-biochem-final-blues.

Best Irish Pub in Tempe.  Usually has Live entertainment on the busy nights.  It is super pricey, so I would suggest pregamming it at the house or a dive before you make a night out of this place.  Happy hour is a smokin deal for food, which is excellent by the way.  Hit up the fish and chips or any of your Irish faves...

Few places on Mill Ave have stayed the same since I received my horizontal Arizona ID card... Rula Bula is one of them! And, it's kept all of the same 'charm' to remind us (whether we like to or not) of all of the crazy times back in college and even the times after we graduated when acted like we were still enrolled.  Rula Bula tries to hold true to its Irish theme from everything on the menu to the band that will get you dancing a jig faster than a couple pints of Guinness. The patio is also a fun spot, but get there early to find a seat. I've always found people to be friendly and willing to share a barrel where you can rest your drinks. Don't forget to order a few Irish Car Bombs and sip on some Jameson. In fact, Rula Bula even looks like pub you might stumble upon in Dublin!  Sl√°inte!

Great local spot!  Came in alone for dinner during a business trip. Was seated right away. Tried to decide between a couple Irish sounding entrees and picked the Gaelic Chicken. It was outstanding!  3 chicken breasts smothered in mushroom gravy on top of mashed potatoes. They offer a choice of sides so I chose brussel sprouts and apples - an interesting and delicious combo!  Now I sit here completely satisfied but awaiting a half order of Irish bread pudding to put me over the top.   And did I mention, the service was great too!  I'll be back next time I'm in Tempe

Great food and atmosphere situated on Mill Avenue near ASU. You won't find an obnoxious co-ed crowd who can't handle their liquor. The food is a little pricier than some of the other establishments along Mill Avenue which usually keeps the bad seeds out of the way. Excellent appetizers and sandwiches. Pleasant waitstaff. Reasonable prices and generous portions. One of the best Irish pubs in the Phoenix metro area.

Ordered 2 shepard's pie...both were very tiny appetizer sized portions for an entrees price.  Had more peas than beef and one person ended up getting sick.    Service was decent but will definitely not be back.  Not even close to worth the price.

Last night was my first time eating here, and I'd definitely go back! We got 2 appetizers, potato skins & the potato balls, both amazing! I got the veggie sandwich for dinner, which was out of this world!! The only downside, was that our waiter was not exactly the greatest, definitely needed lessons in keeping the drinks full. Other than that, great place!

Great location.  Decent food.  Okay alcohol selection.  It is no Fibbermagee's.  It's not what I would call authentic Irish pub, but its a fun commercial knock off.  Better than most selections on Mill Avenue.

My wife and I meet for lunch here at least once a week. My favorite foods are fish and chips and Irish Steak Salad. Ice tea is great too. Particularly great during the winter when you can sit out on the patio.

Love it there but unfortunately last Saturday was not a good experience. The bartender outside was rude and with an attitude his name if I'm correct is Ryan other than him great place for Irish car bombs!

I love this place. I had been craving shepherds pie for weeks and finally found a place that makes it exactly how I like it! My friend got the bangers and mash and that was fantastic as well. My boyfriend got the Mac and cheese burger which, of course, was delicious! Plus I love their half and half beer list, too ;) and this building is beautiful inside and out. Love their patio! The only reason I don't give it five stars is because I wish the kitchen was open later, since it closes at 10.
Cute atmosphere, a few good beers on tap, good sliders. The waitress was kind of a snob and looked "busy" even though there were only like 4 other people at the bar, so that was weird.

This was our second stop for the night at one of my friends going away party.  There was a $2 cover since there was a band playing that night.  I'm sure the band was good...I can't really remember.  But what I did remember is the drinks being a little on the weak side.  Now, I understand that I am a professional drinker, so drinks naturally seem weak to me, but my friends said the same thing and they are light weights.   The staff was very polite, so there are no complaints about the service.  It was pretty packed, but not rowdy.  I'll probably give it another try.

Finally got around to satisfying my fish and chips craving and I'm very happy I came here for it. The entire atmosphere and decore of this place is awesome and comfortable. And as the fish and chips go; Flakey, golden brown, delicious fish with a side of really yummy cocktail sauce and the chips were just perfectly salty. I'll definitely be back soon.

I go to Rula Bula every Wednesday night for the Brainstorm Pub Quiz. My friends and I love trivia, and Rula Bula hosts one of the best in town. The questions are difficult, the teams are serious, and the food and drinks are great.  Now, the reason for a 3-star review -- we come here every week, with a reservation made, and we still have problems. Sometimes they don't have a table for us, sometimes they cancel trivia at the last minute because they don't have the proper paperwork. It just seems a bit disorganized.  I give the food and drink a thumbs up, but the service, staff and organization a thumbs down.

I went to Rula Bula for brunch for the first time yesterday morning. I went with a big group of friends - 14, to be exact. We made a reservation, so they knew ahead of time how many of us would be there. We also told them ahead of time that we would be requiring separate checks. They were understaffed, clearly, because our poor waitress was overwhelmed. This was definitely a problem as we began ordering food and drinks. It's irritating to call in advance and give a heads up regarding some of the more complicated aspects of our party, in hopes of making the experience easier for everyone, only for the staff to be under prepared. Obviously, it took quite a bit of time for us to get our food. When we did get it, the food was lukewarm, or in some cases cold. While I understand the desire to serve the food all at once, I would rather they have served us a little at a time. We were never given the option of choosing. At the end, separating the checks turned out to be a disaster. After our waitress separated the checks, there was one mimosa unaccounted for - she couldn't remember who ordered it - so she tacked it onto someone's check. When the person stated to the waitress that she hadn't ordered the mimosa, the waitress responded and said that someone had to pay for it and she couldn't remember who ordered it. There was no attempt to figure it out, just an assumption that adding it to another person's ticket was acceptable. IT WAS NOT. I understand that being saddled with 14 guests at one table is difficult, but charging someone for an item they didn't purchase and justifying it in that way was not ok. The only reason I gave this 3 stars is because the food was good. The French toast is incredible and I would definitely recommend it. But Rula, you gotta step up your serving game.
Always love the fish and chips here! Great patio and inside decor. Love the Guinness float for dessert.
Most authentic Irish restaurant in Arizona!  Amazing lamb stew and fish and chips!  The oysters Rockefeller were awesome, but quite small for the price!!!

My daughter was treating me to lunch. Even though our family avoids the over-congested, over-hyped Mill Ave circus like the plague, we decided that Irish food is what we had a hankering for. I knew that Rula Bula had great Yelp reviews and it was close to the ASU art museum we planned on visiting. I had the Bistro Filet Medallions ($9) and my daughter had the Irish Stew ($8). Her 2 year old son had the fish and chips kids meal ($6). My daughter also had the Magners Cider. Overall the food was good, but I was a little surprised by the whiskey-peppercorn gravy on my meat and mashed potatoes. When they say whiskey, they are not kidding. This is the first time I have ever had a gravy with vapor-action!  Pros: Good food, nice Irish pub vibe, and a misted patio that would be nice if it weren't in full sun on a 105 degree day with 45% humidity.  Cons: Parking, parking, parking. There is no parking lot for this restaurant. There is a pay-$2-per-hour lot next door to the restaurant. That means that we will not be making a return visit to this establishment. The valley has way too many restaurant options to put up with being gouged for parking.

It was "Ok"  I enjoyed the French Onion soup and grilled cheese & bacon sandwich.    Have to say they should toast the top of the FO soup longer, a better crouton would not hurt and maybe let it meld a little longer.   The sandwich, the pasta was a waste.  I removed that and enjoyed the sandwich better.  Atmosphere was dated, and blah.    Maybe as a lunch spot, but I doubt I'd do a dinner here again ... sorry

Brussels Sprouts never tasted so good.  The place is tops for ambiance and good Irish comfort food.  The perfect place when you want to visit Mill Ave but don't want to deal with the college debauchery.

I've always enjoyed Rula Bula for happy hour. They have a nice patio and decent food and drink specials. The food has always been okay. After my last experience there, fish and chips will never be the same. I noticed two black specks in the malt vinegar on my plate. Upon further examination, I saw that they were dead flies. I raised the bottle of vinegar into the sunlight and noticed about 75 more of them at the bottom. I was feeling nauseous as I had already had a few bites. The waitress was sorry, offered to bring me a new order. Didn't take anything off the bill, though. Guess I should have talked to a manager.
Joe was effen awesome. Took good care of me and tiff. Was the kind of bartender you just feel good with. Dont get married.

I did like the ambiance of this place...We sat outside weather was awesome. We ordered a bottle of wine.   We had the Irish Chips with melted cheddar cheese, pico de gallo, jalape√±os, sour cream and chipotle pepper sauce., it was actually very good. I've never had it with potatoes! Yumm! The Buffalo Wings were BOMB! Did I mention that the Chips were off the hook! Feed me potato's!!!!  Downside:  The waiter was way chatty...and a little irritating. Before we ordered the bottle of wine I selected a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon, it was gross. I asked him to give me another selection and he clearly stated, "My manager won't let me take it back I need to charge you for it." I was in shock...I couldn't believe it so I started laughing.  At that point I told him to bring me a bottle of what my GF was drinking since it was way better and forget about the whole nasty glass of wine. It's all in the delivery of the message dude...I don't care if you charge me for it. At least go and pretend to talk to your manager then tell me you can't. Duh, It's called customer service. You know the line of work your in....Just Sayin!

Your run of the mill irish bar.  They have pub foods, they have the substandard bar service you would expect when not ordering a rye on the rocks or a guiness.  The other reviewers are quite correct when they say it is a haven from the torrent of douchebaggery happening outside and at the other venues.  Then again, you are in Tempe.  What do you expect?  People don't go to ASU for academic achievement.

Came here for a drink with a friend and a group dinner.  So many drink options at the bar and my favorite cider was on hand.  =)  There is an outdoor patio in the back that we had reserved all to ourselves.  There is a bar out here as well so you won't be empty handed for long.  Since it was highly recommended on Yelp and by our server, I ordered the shepard's pie.  I kept thinking of the Friends episode when Rachel tried to make a trifle and made a trifle/shepards pie.  This was nothing like that and was very yummy.  Brussel sprouts were served on the side which I could have lived without.  We also ordered potato skins which went very well with my drink.  Great spot.  Great service.  I definitely come back again.

I'd give them five stars if the servers weren't crabby ALL of the time and the bathrooms weren't a mess. And by mess I mean the t.p. dispensers are broken, some doors don't have locks, and they smell bad.   Otherwise, the food is awesome and all of the beer offerings are, too. I've had a few of the sandwiches, and the fish are chips are my favorite--big fish, great batter.  I hate that some establishments feel like, "we're unique and in high demand, so just deal with our shitty service and amenities." BUT I still come here and they know I will. Damn them.
Great service and love the vibe. Much more mellow then the rest of Mill Avenue. Absolutely love this place.

Don't tell my husband I'm giving Rula Bula 3 stars.  He thinks it deserves 4.  But he should try earning his little Elite badge and write his own review I say.  After Zoolights fell through on Saturday night (not interested in walking from a parking lot in Chandler to get there), we found ourselves on Mill, which is actually only the 2nd time I've ever been on Mill.  My husband, on the other hand, had too many months unsupervised in the Valley before I joined him, and has apparently visited many of these fine establishments, including Rula Bula.  Not being a huge fan of Irish food, or beer for that matter, I decided this would be the 1 in 100 dining experiences I let him choose.  I loved  the interior I must say.  And the menu is not so bad either.  If I could find quesadillas and hot wings in Ireland, I might just visit.  But so as to not completely humiliate my husband, I ordered a cider, rather than a margarita, and fish 'n chips.  The cider was perfect, not too sweet.  If only beer should taste this good...  The fish (cod) was perfectly cooked and the batter was flavorful.  I just wish it was a little more crispy.  Perhaps it didn't hold up to my splash of vinegar.  The chips were near perfect, except I wish the fish hadn't been plopped on top as it caused them to lose their crispiness, too.  I would be happy to come back to Rula Bula again.  They have a great patio with a bar out there as well.  But I think I'll stick to the time of year when ASU is not in session.  I have a sneaking suspicion this place is a different beast when school starts back up.

We really like coming here but this last time, i was not so thrilled. I like the corned beef and cabbage. I think they have changed the way they cut the corned beef, prefer them to cut it thick. We also sat outside because we decided to eat during the Tempe Art Festival. Regretted that move. Smokers sitting at the bar that was right behind my table. I am the worst kind of complainer of cigarette smoke, i quit smoking years ago and the smell just gets to me. I have the nose from hell and i kept smelling it, gag me. I Still like the atmosphere of this place and not writing it off yet, i will just chose to eat in doors and order something different.  I would however love more options for my gluten free allergy.  Sure, we'll come back.
Great Irish pub on Mill Ave in Tempe, close to the Light Rail stop.  Definitely worth the visit for a shot of Jameson's and a beer.  Fast and friendly service.
The shepherds pie, grilled cheese with Mac and cheese and the champ potatoes were very tasty. My son is still talking about the potatoes!

Comfort food and relaxed surroundings. It would be a place to come in out of the cold except that it's in Phoenix. Still, the old-world charm and hearty food make it great place to get fat and happy. The location leaves you with plenty to see along Mill Ave as you walk off the Bangers and Mash.

Rula Bula is the place to go if you're...  1. Stuck on Mill (no offense Mill...my 21 year old former self loves you and I always know to visit you first if I want a crazy time!) 2. Looking for a bar with people drinking themselves to the point of having a good time  3. Want to participate in events like trivia night   Rula Bula is a good time. But you have to go into it expecting to walk into a bar atmosphere hiding behind a restaurant. The patio is fun and there's plenty of room to sit. The food is decent and true to Irish dining. But I really don't think people go for the food. Every time I've gone, food has been an after-thought.   Be prepared to stand and wait for a seat if you're visiting after a festival or game. Rula Bula is practically the first stop after the light rail and Tempe Town Lake so it's a hot commodity! So my advice is to stick to Rula Bula if you've had some cocktails and won't mind the pub feel!
Service is so bad. Waitress keep continue to ask same things over and over again

I have been here numerous times the last 10 years, and I feel the same about it every time.  It is an okay place.  The atmosphere is your typical Irish venue.  It can be lively, or it can be dull depending on the day you go.  We went before the Devils vs Cats Basketball game and I was expecting lively but it ended up being tame.  The fish and chips are decent here.  But their happy hour fare was not good.  My bloody mary was not good as well.    The patio is a great spot to chill at, and with the great weather we have been having I suggest grabbing a seat outside.    Overall its a C

3 and a HALF stars  I really like the large patio in the back-definitely an older and not as rowdy in the annoying BroDawg screaming for no good-goddamn reason, but more bustling like friends come here to chill the fuck out. The way a good pub should be.  However-my dining experiences and some day experiences in the past have not been great AT ALL. I found the bartenders lacking that extra mile, esp. when there was hardly anyone in there and I was at the bar alone-in a real pub, that is an opportunity to chat a little bit. I don't mean I want to tell them my lifestory, but man...its a bit awkward! Also the veggie burger was lacking and became a mess all over my hands due to some mysterious fucking leaky ass sauce. So I couldn't recommend this place for a long while 'cause everytime I went, it left me disappointed and hollow. It was also the worst poured Guiness I had ever had, too.  BUT-the bartender out back was awesome and it is a good vibe (how hippy does that sound-damn, the west is changing me!), really spacious, huge beers at reasonable prices.

I'm in love with the Iron Druid chronicles books so I was excited to see if their fish and chips lives up to how Atticus describes it in the book.  AMAZING.  My BF doesn't eat seafood and he wished he could ordered his own instead of having a bite of mine.  Their Hot Bollix Spicy Potato Balls are unreal.  They come with buffalo sauce.
